Agents¶

Base Agent¶

This module defines the base agent class. Here is where a lot of the communication logic and the main negotiation loop is defined.

class pyneg.agent.agent.Agent[source]¶

Bases: object

Base negotiation agent. This class handles most things like the main negotiation loop, communication, and genrally acts like a hub for other classes.

Public Methods:

  • receive_negotiation_request(self, opponent: Agent, neg_space: NegSpace) -> bool:

  • negotiate(self, opponent: Agent) -> bool:

  • send_message(self, opponent: Agent, msg: Message) -> None

  • receive_message(self, msg: Message) -> None

  • generate_next_message(self) -> Message

  • add_utilities(self, new_utils: Dict[str, float]) -> bool

  • set_utilities(self, new_utils: Dict[str, float]) -> bool

__init__() → None[source]¶

Setup all the class attributes, but we don’t assign them meaningful values here. That is all handled by the factory. They are initialised here to make the linters a bit happier.

name = None¶

Name of the agent. mainly used for logging

receive_negotiation_request(opponent: pyneg.agent.agent.Agent, neg_space: Dict[str, List[str]]) → bool[source]¶

Public function that allows other agents to propose a negoation.

Parameters

  • opponent (Agent) – Agent that is proposing the negotiation. Usually called with self as argument

  • neg_space (NegSpace) – Negotiation space that negotiation will take place in

Returns

True if and only if the request for negotiation is accepted

Return type

bool

_accepts_negotiation_proposal(neg_space) → bool[source]¶

determines if the agent should accept the call for negotiation. Currently this just checks if the proposed negotiation space is equal to it’s own, since this otherwise leads to inconsistencies.

Parameters

neg_space (NegSpace) – the negotiation space that the proposed negotiation would take place in.

Returns

whether the negotiation is accepted or not

Return type

bool

_call_for_negotiation(opponent: pyneg.agent.agent.Agent, neg_space: Dict[str, List[str]]) → bool[source]¶

Send a message to opponent to request a negotiation and wait for the response.

Parameters

  • opponent (Agent) – The agent self want’s to negotiate with

  • neg_space (NegSpace) – The negotiation space self want’s to negotiate in

Returns

Whether opponent accepted the request to negotiate

Return type

bool

negotiate(opponent: pyneg.agent.agent.Agent) → bool[source]¶

This is the entrypoint to run a negotiation, and where the main loop is located. self is assumed to have set up the negotiation before hand, meaning that it must have both a neotiation space and a utility function defined. This should be the case if the agent was created by the factory. See Setting up agents for a negotiation for more information.

Parameters

opponent (Agent) – Agent that self is going to negotiate with

Returns

Whether the negotiation came to an agreement or not.

Return type

bool

_terminate(successful: bool) → pyneg.comms.message.Message[source]¶

Generate the message that signals to the opporent that the negotiaion has ended and whether it was successful or not. If it was successful the message includes the offer that was accepted.

Parameters

successful (bool) – Whether the agents wants to terminate with agreement (True) or without agreement (False)

Raises

RuntimeError – Raised if this function is called while no negotiation is active or no opponent is known.

Returns

The message that will signal to the opponent that the negotiation has ended as speciffied.

Return type

Message

send_message(opponent: pyneg.agent.agent.Agent, msg: pyneg.comms.message.Message) → None[source]¶

Sends a message to the opponent, and records the communication in the transcript Message should be one allowed by the protocol which is defined in Message Types

Parameters

  • opponent (Agent) – The opponent to send the message to

  • msg (Message) – The message to send

_wait_for_response(sender: pyneg.agent.agent.Agent) → None[source]¶
_record_message(msg: pyneg.comms.message.Message) → None[source]¶

appends message to transcript

Parameters

msg (Message) – The message to be appended

receive_message(msg: pyneg.comms.message.Message) → None[source]¶

Main entry point for other agents to send messages to self. records the message in the transcript, parses the message so the engine can do the reasoing next.

Parameters

msg (Message) – Message to be parsed

_parse_response(response: pyneg.comms.message.Message)[source]¶

Parse a recieved message. If the message was either acceptance or termination we terminate the negotiation loop appropriately otherwise, if the message included a constraint we incorporate it and check if we can accept the received proposal.

Parameters

response (Message) – The message to be parsed

_should_exit() → bool[source]¶

Determine if we should end the negotiation without agreement. currently the only triger for this is when the engine can’t find new proposals, but allows arbitrary logic.

Raises

RuntimeWarning – Raised if the engine is not properly initialised, or no negotiation is active.

Returns

True if and only if the agent should terminate unsucessfully

Return type

bool

generate_next_message() → pyneg.comms.message.Message[source]¶

Generates the next message to be sent in a negotiation. Generates acceptance or termination message if appropriate, otherwise asks engine to generate new offer and sends message containing that offer.

Raises

RuntimeError – Raised if no negotiation is active

Returns

The message to be sent back

Return type

Message

accepts(offer: pyneg.comms.offer.Offer) → bool[source]¶

Determines whether an offer is acceptable or not. Mostly just a passthrough to the engine who does th4e actual reasoning.

Parameters

offer (Offer) – The offer to consider

Returns

true if the agent finds the offer acceptable

Return type

bool

add_utilities(new_utils: Dict[str, float]) → bool[source]¶

Adds new utilities to the knowledge base so the engine can reason about them properly. Returns False if adding the utility makes the current negotiation impossible.

Parameters

new_utils (Dict[str, float]) – New utility rules to be added

Returns

Whether a solution is still possible according to the agent.

Return type

bool

set_utilities(new_utilities: Dict[str, float]) → bool[source]¶

Overrides utilities int the knowledge base. Returns False if adding the utility makes the current negotiation impossible.

Parameters

new_utils (Dict[str, float]) – New utility rules

Returns

Whether a solution is still possible according to the agent.

Return type

bool

Constraint Agent¶

This module contains the logic for agents that know how to reason about constraints. It basically only contains the ConstrainedAgent class

class pyneg.agent.constr_agent.ConstrainedAgent[source]¶

Bases: pyneg.agent.agent.Agent

A negotiation agent that has additional logic to deal with constraints. For now only atomic constraints are supported

Public functions:

  • add_constraint(self, constraint) -> None

  • get_unconstrainted_values_by_issue(self,issue) -> Set[str]

  • get_constraints(self) -> Set[AtomicConstraint]

  • accepts(self, offer: Offer) -> bool

__init__()[source]¶

constraint agent constructor. As with other agents, everything is set by the factory

add_constraint(constraint: pyneg.comms.atomic_constraint.AtomicConstraint) → None[source]¶

Register a constraint with the agent and it’s engine :param constraint: the constraint to be added :type constraint: AtomicConstraint

get_unconstrained_values_by_issue(issue) → Set[str][source]¶

Returns a set containing all unconstrained values for a specific issue

Parameters

issue (bool) – The issue of which to retreive the unconstrained values

Returns

A set containing all value strings that have no known constraint associated

Return type

Set[str]

get_constraints() → Set[pyneg.comms.atomic_constraint.AtomicConstraint][source]¶

Returns a set containing all the constraints known to this agent

Returns

Set containing all the constraints known to this agent

Return type

Set[AtomicConstraint]

_accepts_negotiation_proposal(neg_space: Dict[str, List[str]]) → bool[source]¶

Decide whether we should accept the proposal for a negotiation. We accept whenever the negotiatin space being proposed is equal to our own so we can reason about it, and there are still solutions possible.

Parameters

neg_space (NegSpace) – The negotiation space the proposed negotiation will take part in

Returns

Whether the agents agrees to start a negotiation

Return type

bool

accepts(offer: pyneg.comms.offer.Offer) → bool[source]¶

Determines whether the agent finds the provided offer acceptable.

Parameters

offer (Offer) – The offer to consider

Returns

True if and only if the agent accepts the proposal

Return type

bool
